Lambert the Sheepish Lion

In this delightful tale of courage and strength, Lambert the lion achieves greatness in the face of adversity. Mistakenly delivered by the stork, Lambert found growing up in a family of sheep to be a real challenge. He was raised to nosh on grass instead of meat, to baa rather than roar, and to head-butt rather than bare his teeth. Though Lambert’s upbringing made him a target of ridicule among the other lions, he soon earned their respect by saving the sheep from becoming a wolf’s next meal.

Tie-in Activity: Ask your child to list the challenges that would be created by other unlikely animal pairings, such as a dog being raised in a family of cats or a mouse growing up in a family of elephants. Encourage her to talk about how each animal might adapt, and then draw pictures of the blended animal families.
